Did Calculus Exist in the Vedic and Post Vedic Periods?

  • November 18, 2024
  • 1 min read

Introduction

When we think of calculus, most of us picture Western mathematicians like Newton or Leibniz, who are credited with its invention. But what if I told you that the roots of calculus could trace back to ancient India, specifically the Vedic and Post Vedic periods? This blog explores fascinating evidence from ancient Indian texts and mathematicians that suggests calculus wasnâ€™t a modern inventionâ€”it might have been around for centuries before.
